Sentencas: In this study, the microwave heating conversion of carbon dioxide linked with methane and steam, a greenhouse gas, was investigated to show the possibility for chemical energy storage.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: In the CO2 gasification, CO2 reacts with fixed carbon in carbon receptors to produce CO, and the CO2 conversion was 81.9%.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: Additionally, CO2 conversion was high when the carbon receptor temperature was high and the volumetric hourly space velocity was low.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: In the case of dry reforming, for which CH4 was supplied with the CO2, CH4 converted to hydrogen and black carbon by thermal decomposition.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: The black carbon attached to the activated centers on the carbon receptor and interrupted the conversion.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: But CO2 conversion was 81.8%, which was not significantly different from that of the CO2 gasification.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: In case of the CO2-steam reforming and combined reforming which were supplied steam, however, both CO2 conversions drastically decreased to 43.9% and 36.6%, respectively, because of the reduced reactivity of the active centers caused by steam condensation in the carbon acceptor.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: The heating value of the product gas was the highest (14.64 MJ m(-3)) in the dry reforming, showing the best value as fuel.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion

Sentencas: The H-2/CO ratio of the CO2-steam reforming was the largest value of 1.29, enabling fuel cell applications such as solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion
Methane-steam linkage characteristics in microwave carbon dioxide energy conversion
